name: Intro
_source: speak;James;I'm sure you've realized this, Madeline,{w} but Marcel is actually a woman.
speak;James;She works as a waitress in a restaurant in the red-light district at night.
speak;James;She goes by the stage-name of Rachel.
speak;Madeline;Marcel.{w}{clear}Does this mean I'm a lesbian?
speak;James;Take off your clothes then,{w} if you've got nothing to hide!
speak;Marcel;Look closely, Madeline,{w} at the bump on his head.{w}{clear}Undeniable proof.
speak;Alice;Is your axe a conceptual weapon?
speak;Anthony;Did you question Marcel about his?
speak;Anthony;So you want an idea of what he believes in?
speak;Anthony;But!{w} I can speculate.{w}{clear}Would you like to hear a story?
speak;Anthony;Are you sure?{w}{clear}I'll warn you,{w} it's not a very happy story.
speak;Alice;That's alright.{w}{clear}I want to hear it.;;100;;;;;;1

speak;Anthony;Our mother was a very kind woman.{w}{clear}She spent a lot of time with Marcel and I.{w}{clear}Marcel especially.{w}{clear}He was born in a sickly sort of coma,{w} so she developed a habit of fawning over him,{w} which persisted into the later years of his childhood.{w}{clear}Father called him spoilt,{w} and coddled,{w} and said she had ruined him as a soldier,{w} and I mimicked Father in a joking sort of way,{w} not sure why,{w} maybe jealously... anyway.{w}{clear}One day, when I was coming back in from training,{w} in a wagon like this one,{w}{clear}A man from the castle sat in beside me and spoke,{w} sort of in an offhand way,{w}{clear}Saying that the queen had passed away.{w}{clear}He looked then across and saw who I was,{w} and I asked if he could repeat.{w}{clear}So he told me.{w}{clear}I would've asked him again but he jumped out at the first opportunity.{w}{clear}Even then,{w} for days,{w} it didn't quite settle in.{w}{clear}Maybe instead of saying "passed away" -{w} if the passenger had said she was dead,{w} the message might have set in sooner...

speak;Anthony;I voulunteered to carry the coffin at the funeral.{w}{clear}Marcel was in bed with a fever.{w}{clear}As my father and I watched the burial...{w}{clear}I remember that the dirt made a very strange noise whenever it hit at the lid,{w}{clear}Then I noticed that the thuds weren't quite matching up exactly with what I was hearing,{w}{clear}And so I turned to my father,{w} standing there crying.{w}{clear}Then finally I understood.

speak;Anthony;A big block of ice moved into my head,{w} and it hasn't really gone away since.{w}{clear}And it was bad for Marcel too.{w}{clear}You can't understand, at that age,{w} or rather,{w} you can't trick yourself into understanding,{w} that people can -{w} die for no reason at all.{w}{clear}He looked around for a culprit,{w} someone to pin the blame,{w} to take out his frustration,{w} saw no one to blame,{w} turned the frustration inward,{w} and blamed himself.{w}{clear}He said to me that what happened was...{w}{clear}A natural and just reward for a family of soldiers trained to kill others,{w}{clear}That we could not kill others and expect to get away with it ourselves.{w}{clear}The idea of karma,{w} the desire to atone -{w}{clear}This is what forms, I think,{w} the crux of his beliefs.
speak;Anthony;But that was a while ago.{w}{clear}Things are alright now.{w}{clear}After a time...
speak;Anthony;Things went back to how they almost used to be.
speak;Elizabeth;Good morning, Alice.{w}{clear}Anthony, I spotted something very strange on the road.
speak;Claudia;Remind me,{w} my self-professed 'genius' brother.{w}{clear}Why,{w} exactly,{w} are we chasing horses on foot?
speak;Claude;Never said I was a genius.
speak;Claudia;We should've waited to get help back at town.
speak;Claude;Easy to say so in retrospect,{w} but you didn't say anything then.
speak;Claudia;Explain then how your decisiveness has led you to pick,{w} out of a sea of options,{w} the absolute worst possible one?
speak;Claude;Easy to say so when you don't make any decisions yourself.
speak;Claudia;You don't let me make any.
speak;Anthony;Are you lost, by any chance?
speak;Anthony;But weren't you a girl... no, wait,{w} you were twins...{w} ah!
speak;Anthony;I do remember!{w}{clear}So the girl behind is Claudia!
speak;Claudia;Anthony, can we ride in your wagons to catch up to them?
speak;Marcel;How long have you been travelling?
speak;Claudia;Around a week.{w}{clear}We hardly had time to sleep.{w}{clear}Claude didn't get any at all.
# James steps out, as well as a few others
speak;Elizabeth;Anthony.{w}{clear}There's a cavalry regiment coming up the road.
speak;Marcel;Most of our troops are resting.
speak;Anthony;They can't get to him without getting past us.{w}{clear}Leave him locked up in the wagon.{w}{clear}Elizabeth, watch over him.
speak;SoldierRed;Shouldn't we wait for the remaining cavalry regiments?

speak;Dempsey;Fintan has deliberately put us here to claim all the glory for himself.{w}{clear}There's no point standing around.{w}{clear}But what do you prefer?{w}{clear}To stand for nothing?{w}{clear}Or to fight?
